sources.title: "The Average Woman" (1924) starring Pauline Garon, Harrison Ford
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   "The Average Woman" is a comedy-drama. This film lets us enjoy one of very few surviving performances of Pauline Garon, a French Canadian actress who made a successful career in Hollywood.   Directed by               Christy Cabanne Produced by             C.C. Burr Productions Inc. Scenario                      Raymond S. Harris from the short story “The Average Woman” by Dorothy De Jagers Starring                     Pauline Garon, David Powell, Harrison Ford, Burr McIntosh Cinematography        John W. Brown, Neil Sullivan Distributed by           Paramount Pictures Release date               March 1, 1924 Running time             48 min. Country                      United States Language                    Silent film, English intertitles   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: Reporter Jimmy Munroe is writing an article on "the average woman". He meets Sally Whipple in the library and chooses her as a likely subject, following her around to gather material for his article, and eventually falls in love with her. Her father, Judge Whipple, doesn't like it; he has Jimmy arrested and allows him to see Sally only once a week. Meanwhile, disreputable businessman Van Alten is after Sally, and tries to pressure her into marrying him by threatening to release letters he says will embarrass her father.
metadata.Actors: Pauline Garon, David Powell, Harrison Ford
